bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Aristides Agramonte, December 7, 1912

div1.p: Kean states that Carroll was responsible for the injustice done to Agramonte. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Aristides Agramonte, December 7, 1912
div1.opener:
JG File
Dec. 7, 1912
Dr. Aristides Agramonte,
Calle K, Entre 15 Y 17,
Vedado, Habana, Cuba.
My dear Dr. Agramonte:
div1.p:
The Surgeon General has signed and mailed to the Yellow
Fever Bureau in Liverpool a letter of which the enclosed is a copy, and
enclosing a copy of your own statement. I think that it would not be
possible to vindicate your share in the work of the tropical board more
fully. Of course we cannot now state that it was Carroll who was the
author of the injustice done you but I think the acceptance by this office
of your statement is all that is necessary to put you right.

I hope we may see you in Washington as you state in your letter may
be possible.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, (sgd) J. R. K. Lt. Colonel, Medical Corps.
